channel.copyright: Copyright 2015 The New York Times Company

item.title: Russia Shows Off Ordnance in Victory Day Parade
item.description: Victory Day is Russia’s most important secular holiday, both commemorating the Soviet Union’s suffering during World War II and highlighting Russia’s image as a force for peace and security.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS
item.media:description: On the 70th anniversary of the defeat of Nazi Germany, Russia held its largest military parade since the fall of the Soviet Union.

item.title: Campus Debates on Israel Drive a Wedge Between Jews and Minorities
item.description: Student groups nationwide are proposing that their colleges divest from companies that do business with Israel, a sign that a campaign is gaining traction.
item.dc:creator: JENNIFER MEDINA and TAMAR LEWIN
item.media:description: Celebrating Israel’s Independence Day last month at U.C.L.A. Some students said that while they had never hidden that they were Jewish, they felt uncomfortable voicing their support for Israel.

item.title: Kenan Evren, Leader of Turkey’s 1980 Coup, Dies at 97
item.description: General Evren imposed the harshest repression in his country’s history, leading to his trial and conviction more than 30 years later.
item.category: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
item.dc:creator: STEPHEN KINZER

item.title: Dozens Die and 40 Escape in Iraqi Prison Riot
item.description: The riot at Khalis prison in eastern Iraq killed at least six police officers and 30 prisoners, Iraqi authorities said on Saturday.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Battle Tested, Ukraine Troops Now Get U.S. Basic Training
item.description: After months on the front lines, Ukrainian National Guard members are being trained in basic skills as part of a $19 million American military effort.
item.dc:creator: ANDREW E. KRAMER
item.media:credit: Brendan Hoffman for The New York Times
item.media:description: Ukrainian soldiers were drilled by American military trainers in Yavoriv, in the country’s west.

item.title: Four Killed as Military Transport Plane Crashes in Spain
item.description: Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy said that up to 10 crew members were aboard the brand-new Airbus A400M aircraft that was undergoing flight trials at the Seville airport.
item.dc:creator: REUTERS

item.title: Monsoons Near, Nepal Focuses on Sanitation to Stem Illness After Quake
item.description: Two weeks after a devastating earthquake, Nepal’s government and charitable groups are racing to beat monsoon season and working to provide clean water and toilets to minimize contamination into local water supplies.
item.dc:creator: GARDINER HARRIS
item.media:description: Saili, 25, from Selang, said that her 2-year-old son died in the earthquake and that her home was destroyed. She and her two surviving children are now living in a shelter with four other families.

item.title: Rift Forms in Germany Over Asylum
item.description: Taking in asylum seekers in Germany has infused Roman Catholic and Protestant churches with a newfound sense of social purpose, but the government considers the practice illegal.
item.dc:creator: MELISSA EDDY
item.media:credit: Laetitia Vancon for The New York Times
item.media:description: The Rev. Peter Brummer of the St. Joseph Roman Catholic church in Tutzing, Germany, talking with one of the area’s asylum seekers in March as two others, Abdullah Zadran, left, and a man who identified himself only as Ali, second from left, looked on.

item.title: Op-Ed Columnist: The Suicide of Britain
item.description: David Cameron’s nation is a kingdom that may not be united for long.
item.dc:creator: ROSS DOUTHAT

item.title: Reader Tips on Finding a Partner Using Indian Marriage Sites
item.description: We asked readers how to navigate the more than 1,500 matchmaking sites in India giving people thousands of choices on choosing a potential spouse.
item.dc:creator: SHREEYA SINHA
item.media:description: Kadhambari Sridhar's first photo with the man she eventually married, taken at the Washington Zoo in October 2014.

item.title: News Analysis: Appeal to Dwindling Core Proves Costly for Labour Party in Britain
item.description: Ed Miliband, who built a campaign strategy of taxation of the rich and added social spending, resigned as the head of Labour after the party’s defeat in elections.
item.dc:creator: STEVEN ERLANGER and STEPHEN CASTLE
item.media:description: Ed Miliband, whose election strategy rebuffed that of Tony Blair, resigned Friday after five years as the Labour Party leader.

item.title: Liberia Conquers Ebola, but Faces a Crisis of Faith
item.description: Churches have been holding special prayers, revivals and workshops, with the purpose of refastening ties frayed by Ebola, a disease that made many fear those closest to them.
item.dc:creator: NORIMITSU ONISHI
item.media:credit: Daniel Berehulak for The New York Times
item.media:description: Worshipers at United God Is Our Light Pentecostal church in Monrovia, Liberia. After an Ebola patient was brought for a healing last year, eight congregants died.

item.title: Egyptian Court Upholds Mubarak Verdict
item.description: The court reconfirmed a corruption conviction of former President Hosni Mubarak amid signals from the authorities that he may soon be released.
item.dc:creator: DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK

item.title: 300,000 March Through Moscow With Portraits of WWII Veterans
item.description: About 300,000 people have walked through central Moscow holding portraits of relatives who fought in World War II.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS
item.media:description: Defense officials participated in a military parade in Moscow on Saturday.

item.title: Scottish Nationalists Rejoice in Big British Election Win
item.description: The bid for Scottish independence from Britain may have failed last year, but it set in motion forces that ended Labour Party dominance in Scotland.
item.dc:creator: KATRIN BENNHOLD
item.media:credit: David Cheskin/Press Association, via Associated Press
item.media:description: Mhairi Black, 20, with Douglas Alexander, the senior Labour Parliament member she defeated.

item.title: Liberia Is Declared Free of Ebola, but Officials Sound Note of Caution
item.description: The announcement Saturday made Liberia the first of the hardest-hit West African countries, including Guinea and Sierra Leone, to bring a formal end to the epidemic.
item.dc:creator: SHERI FINK
item.media:description: Women celebrated in Monrovia, Liberia, on Saturday as officials declared the Ebola outbreak in their country over.

item.title: Indonesia President, Joko Widodo, Pardons Prisoners in Papua Province
item.description: The pardon by Joko Widodo was part of an effort to address human rights abuses in the country’s restive eastern region.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: JOE COCHRANE

item.title: After Iraqis Wrest Tikrit From ISIS, Sectarian and Tribal Tensions Persist
item.description: Iraq must stabilize the Sunni-dominated area without recreating the sectarian tensions that helped the Islamic State seize it in the first place.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: TIM ARANGO
item.media:description: A member of a Shiite militia patrolled a street in Tikrit, Iraq. A shaky alliance comprising the country's sectarian groups helped drive out the Islamic State from the city.

item.title: Accused of Spying for China, Until She Wasn’t
item.description: A National Weather Service flood forecaster faced federal economic espionage charges, until her case was dropped as abruptly as it had upended her life.
item.dc:creator: NICOLE PERLROTH
item.media:credit: Maddie McGarvey for The New York Times
item.media:description: Sherry Chen, a hydrologist for the federal government in Ohio, was arrested last October and accused of economic espionage. Afterward, she said, “I did nothing but cry for days.”

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Chinese Debate the Meaning of Alan Mak’s Election to the British Parliament
item.description: For the first time ever, an ethnic Chinese has been elected to the British House of Commons.
item.dc:creator: CAO LI
